common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Launch and Account Linking Issues
common_issues.description: Users report issues with launching the Pieces Desktop app on Windows and macOS, often encountering errors related to core dependencies or OS migration. Account linking, particularly with Google and GitHub, is also problematic, with users unable to link both simultaneously. Proposed solutions include waiting for migration completion, restarting the app, contacting support, and checking for updates.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* The current account linking flow in Pieces is not working properly.
* The user (johnkennyuk) has two accounts, one linked to his GitHub and one to his Google account, and wants to merge them.
* The user has a custom domain set up on his Google account, which he wants to keep as the main account.

**Problems Identified:**

* The account linking flow is not straightforward and is currently being replaced.
* There appears to be a capitalization mismatch in the email addresses associated with the user's accounts.
* The old authentication service provider does not handle linking accounts with different capitalization in emails.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark from Pieces offered to manually merge the accounts.
* Mark suggested the user take a screen recording of the account linking flow.
* Mark reset the user's GitHub account and suggested disabling the "email privacy setting" on GitHub.
* Mark suggested waiting for the new authentication service to be implemented at the end of the month.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is still ongoing. 
* The user will wait for the new authentication service to be implemented before attempting to merge the accounts again.

**Additional Notes:**

* The new authentication service is expected to be ready within the next few weeks.
* The new service will allow linking accounts with different capitalization in emails.

## Overall, 
 
the issue is not yet resolved, but there are promising solutions in the works. The user is advised to wait for the new authentication service before attempting to merge their accounts again.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS won't run
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS won't run
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Cannot launch Pieces for Developers.  The launcher can't find PiecesOS.  If try to launch PiecesOS from the Pieces Suite it says its already running.  I don't see it in the Systray.  I've Repairing, Resetting, and Reinstalling.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User JasonDWilson experiences issues launching the Pieces Windows Desktop version.
* The issue might be related to previous reported issues with launching, core dependencies, and non-dismissable overlays.

**Problems Identified:**

* The user cannot launch the Pieces Windows Desktop version.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The support bot suggested related issues and resources for troubleshooting.
* Mark, a member of the Pieces team, linked to a relevant open issue and offered debugging steps.
* Mark closed this issue, suggesting the user follow the linked issue for updates and troubleshooting.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue was closed, and the user was directed to another issue for further assistance and updates. 
*  It is unclear if the user was able to resolve the issue.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## GitHub Issue Summary: PiecesOS Migration Issue

**Key Points:**

* Pieces is undergoing a major data migration to a new stack with the 11.1.0 release.
* This migration can take a few minutes, especially with large amounts of user data.
* Some users are experiencing issues with the migration, including:
    * Long migration times
    * Missing support directory
    * OS_server.exe running but no tray icon
    * Pieces stuck on "dependencies scenario" tab

**Solutions:**

* Wait a few minutes for the migration to complete.
* Restart the Pieces for Developers Desktop application.
* Contact Pieces support for a call if the issue persists.
* Provide user logs for troubleshooting.
* Try the appInstaller build instead of the exe installer.

**Current Status:**

* Pieces is actively investigating and escalating the issue due to its impact on multiple users.
* Support is available for further assistance and troubleshooting.

**Outcome:**

* The issue is being actively addressed by Pieces. 
* A solution is expected soon.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation highlights the importance of providing detailed information and logs when reporting issues.
* It also demonstrates Pieces' commitment to resolving issues and providing support to its users.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Boot-up and Migration Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties booting PiecesOS after updating to version 11.1.0, often encountering a 'core dependencies' error. This is likely due to ongoing data migration in the new version. Solutions include waiting for migration completion, restarting the application, checking for correct architecture (Arm vs Intel), and contacting Pieces support for further assistance.

related_issues.title: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0
related_issues.text: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0 If you cannot open PiecesOS after updating to 11.1.0 and you are on an arm Machine M1, M2, M3,...etc then it is likely that you accidentally installed the intel version of the application. If you are Unsure. Please uninstall Pieces OS from your applications folder and reinstall from https://docs.pieces.app/installation-getting-started/macos (Arm == Apple Silicon) You can tell if you are working with Arm architecture if you see something that resembles this within your 'About this Mac' If you are still having issues after trying these steps please feel free to add a comment on this issue and schedule a time on my calendar here. https://calendar.app.google/MGd9i5gELtiDjWZm8 No comments found on this issue.

common_issues.title: Ollama Installation and Download Failures
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties installing and downloading Ollama across Windows and Linux operating systems.  This appears to be related to dependency issues with the Pieces OS versions 11.0.0 - 11.1.0.  Updating to the latest Pieces OS version is a suggested fix, as well as ensuring curl is installed.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation on Ollama Installation

**Key Points:**

* User @surya-sengupta reported an issue with Ollama installation not working.
* The issue was automatically triaged by the Pieces Support Bot.
* The user was directed to potentially helpful resources while waiting for a response.
* Brian from the Pieces team suggested updating to Pieces OS version 11.1.0 for stability improvements.

**Problems Identified:**

* Ollama installation was failing for user @surya-sengupta.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Update to Pieces OS version 11.1.0 for improved Ollama stability.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The outcome of the conversation is unclear. It is unknown whether @surya-sengupta tried the update or if the issue was resolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* The provided resources (existing issues, documentation, and YouTube channel) might be helpful for users facing similar issues.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Issue Summary

**Issue:** Pieces cannot download or use Ollama when installed as a Snap package on Ubuntu due to missing `curl` dependency in the sandbox environment.

**Key points:**

* `curl` is required by the package but not included in the Snap sandbox.
* Installing Ollama manually doesn't work because Pieces can't access executables outside the sandbox.
* The issue affects both downloading and inferencing of local LLM models.

**Proposed solutions:**

* Add `curl` to the Snap package's dependency list.
* Modify the package to work within the sandbox environment.

**Current status:**

* A fix is being developed and is expected to be released soon.

**Outcome:**

* Once the fix is released, users will be able to download and use Ollama with the Snap package on Ubuntu.

**Additional points:**

* The issue has been present since at least January 23, 2025.
* Users are requesting a solution to avoid relying on cloud-based LLMs.

## Other resources

* Related issues:
    * Manually downloading a LLM
    * Can't turn on Long-Term Memory Engine
    * 'Finish Onboarding' button stuck
* Documentation: https://docs.pieces.app
* YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/@getpieces

common_issues.title: Pieces for Developers: Installation and Launching Issues
common_issues.description: Users report difficulties installing, launching, and connecting to Pieces for Developers across Windows and Linux.  Problems include launcher failures, dependency errors, and service unavailability.  Solutions involve troubleshooting dependencies, verifying installation, and checking system compatibility.

Feat: Localization(french) for the Desktop Application

Release Notes (code.pieces.app/updates)

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

win 10

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

pieces for developers .....need out in french ,,,,,, where ???
## GitHub Issue Summary: Localization Feature Request

**Key Points:**

* User (@CryptoIngenieur1) requested localization support for Pieces products.
* User expressed interest in knowing the timeline for implementation.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces currently lacks native support for localization.

**Proposed Solutions:**

* Pieces team is actively researching and planning for localization support.

**Implemented Solutions:**

* No immediate solution implemented, but the user will be kept updated.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* No concrete timeline available for localization implementation.
* User acknowledged the response and is awaiting further updates.

related_issues.title: Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
related_issues.text:
Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
Error: Bad state: GetIt: Object/factory with type PiecesWebSocketCreator is not registered inside GetIt. 
(Did you accidentally do GetIt sl=GetIt.instance(); instead of GetIt sl=GetIt.instance;
Did you forget to register it?)

**Installation Details**

Succeeded: false
Path: 

**PiecesOS Information**

ID: 4c9e86c3-7cd9-4905-84a3-be29a48a5a26
User: Anonymous
Current Version: Unknown
Min Version Supported: 11.0.4
Max Version Supported: 12.0.0
Local Port: 39301

**Device Information**

Operating System: Linux
Current Version: Linux 6.8.0-50-generic #51-Ubuntu SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Sat Nov  9 17:58:29 UTC 2024
Min Version Supported: Ubuntu 18
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

- User (@Nagarajan2004) created an issue without providing details.
- The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces team.

**Problems Identified:**

- User didn't provide any details about the issue they were facing with Pieces.
- This makes it difficult for the team to diagnose and resolve the problem.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

- The bot provided links to similar issues and resources that might help the user resolve the problem on their own.
- The team committed to following up with the user within 24 hours for further assistance.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

- The issue is open and awaiting further input from the user.

**Note:**

The conversation doesn't mention any solutions implemented or the final outcome of the issue.

recommendations: "Prioritize resolving the Pieces Desktop app account linking issue as it has been persistent for several years."
"Investigate and address the PiecesOS boot-up and migration issues, particularly the 'core dependencies' error affecting version 11.1.0 users."
"Provide clear guidance and troubleshooting steps for Ollama installation and download failures, specifically addressing dependency issues in Pieces OS versions 11.0.0 - 11.1.0."

"Improve communication and documentation regarding Pieces for Developers installation, launching, and connection issues across Windows and Linux, focusing on launcher failures, dependency errors, and service unavailability."
"Consider implementing a system to detect and prevent accidental installation of the incorrect PiecesOS architecture (Arm vs Intel) on macOS."
